captions: Aloe vera is a succulent with thick, fleshy green leaves containing cooling gel.
It is well known for healing burns and wounds, keeping skin hydrated, and reducing inflammation.
The gel is also consumed to improve digestion, detoxify the body, and boost immunity.
Additionally, Aloe vera supports blood sugar control and promotes overall wellness.
Arali (Nerium oleander) is an evergreen shrub with showy white, pink, or red flowers.
Though highly toxic, it has controlled use in traditional medicine.
It is used as a cardiotonic, diuretic, and expectorant.
Root bark oil is applied for skin diseases and infections.
The plant is also used for fever relief, external treatment of scabies, and even as a natural insecticide.
Avocado (Persea americana) is a fruit tree producing pear-shaped green fruits with creamy flesh and a large seed.
It is valued for its healthy fats, vitamins, and fiber.
Medicinally, avocado supports heart health and lowers cholesterol.
It improves digestion, reduces inflammation, and promotes healthy skin.
It also helps regulate blood sugar.
Basale (Basella alba) is a climbing vine with green or red stems and thick, heart-shaped leaves.
It is also called Malabar spinach and is used both as a vegetable and a medicinal plant.
It is known to treat fever, cough, skin diseases, stomach disorders, and ulcers.
Basale also promotes hair growth, improves immunity, and reduces inflammation.
Brahmi (Bacopa monnieri) is a creeping herb with small succulent green leaves, often found near wetlands.
It is a renowned brain tonic in Ayurveda.
Brahmi improves memory, reduces stress and anxiety, and supports liver health.
It heals ulcers, reduces inflammation, and has anticancer potential.
It is also used for epilepsy and skin problems.
Castor (Ricinus communis) is a tall leafy plant with spiny seed capsules, cultivated mainly for castor oil.
The oil is a powerful laxative and is used for skin care and hair growth.
Castor also helps treat arthritis, tumors, digestive problems, and infections.
Its leaves are used in poultices, and the seeds are known for medicinal oil extraction.
Citron lime (Citrus medica) is a citrus fruit with rough yellow skin and strong fragrance.
It is one of the earliest citrus fruits and is rich in vitamin C.
Medicinally, citron improves digestion, reduces nausea, and cools the body.
It enhances immunity and helps in weight loss.
It also supports arthritis relief and skin health.
Curry leaf (Murraya koenigii) is a small aromatic tree with green leaves used in cooking and Ayurveda.
The leaves are rich in antioxidants and medicinal compounds.
They improve digestion, lower cholesterol, and control diabetes.
Curry leaves prevent infections and enhance memory.
They also protect the liver and support healthy hair growth.
Drumstick tree (Moringa oleifera) is a fast-growing tree with long seed pods and nutritious leaves.
Known as the 'miracle tree,' it is rich in vitamins and antioxidants.
Medicinally, it reduces inflammation, heals stomach ulcers, and controls diabetes.
It lowers cholesterol and boosts immunity.
Its leaves also improve liver function and support heart health.
Ganike (Solanum nigrum), also called black nightshade, is a small plant with green leaves and black berries.
In Ayurveda, it is used to treat fever, stomach disorders, and liver problems.
The leaves are cooked as food and relieve cough, asthma, and skin diseases.
Ganike is also helpful in treating ulcers and inflammation.
Ginger (Zingiber officinale) is a perennial herb with thick underground rhizomes used as spice and medicine.
It is widely known to relieve nausea, improve digestion, and reduce inflammation.
Ginger fights cold and flu, supports heart health, and reduces menstrual pain.
It also acts as an antioxidant with anti-cancer potential.
Hibiscus is a tropical plant with large colorful flowers.
Its petals are used to prepare hibiscus tea, which helps lower blood pressure and cholesterol.
Hibiscus also supports liver health, improves digestion, and boosts immunity.
It promotes healthy skin and hair.
Jasmine (Jasminum spp.) is a fragrant flowering plant with white or yellow blossoms.
It is valued for its calming aroma and is used in teas, perfumes, and medicine.
Jasmine helps reduce stress, improves sleep, and supports skin health.
It boosts immunity and relieves digestive issues.
Lantana (Lantana camara) is a shrub with brightly colored clustered flowers.
In folk medicine, it is used to treat cough, cold, and skin diseases.
Lantana extracts have antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, and wound-healing properties.
It also helps relieve asthma, fever, and digestive disorders.
Malabar nut (Justicia adhatoda) is a shrub with lance-shaped leaves widely used in Ayurveda.
Its leaves are famous for treating cough, asthma, and respiratory infections.
The plant also has anti-inflammatory, expectorant, and antispasmodic properties.
It supports fever reduction, improves breathing, and boosts immunity.
Mint (Mentha spp.) is a fragrant herb with cooling green leaves.
It is commonly used in teas, oils, and remedies for digestive health.
Mint relieves nausea, headaches, and respiratory congestion.
It also has antibacterial, anti-inflammatory, and soothing effects for skin and oral care.
Nerale (Syzygium cumini), also called Jamun or black plum, is a tropical tree with purple fruits.
The fruit is rich in antioxidants, vitamin C, and iron.
In Ayurveda, it is used for diabetes management, digestion, and heart health.
It also boosts immunity, treats ulcers, and helps regulate blood sugar.
Padri (Stereospermum chelonoides) is a large deciduous tree with yellow trumpet-shaped flowers.
In traditional medicine, its bark and roots are used to treat fever, cough, and digestive problems.
Padri helps reduce chest congestion, supports liver health, and strengthens immunity.
Parijatha (Nyctanthes arbor-tristis) is a small tree with white night-blooming fragrant flowers.
It is used in Ayurveda to treat fever, arthritis, and respiratory issues.
The plant supports immunity, relieves cough, and helps in skin disorders.
Parijatha is considered sacred and widely used in traditional rituals.
Pomegranate (Punica granatum) is a shrub with red flowers and fruits filled with juicy seeds.
The fruit is rich in antioxidants and vitamin C, supporting heart health and immunity.
It helps lower blood pressure, fights inflammation, reduces cancer risk, improves digestion, and enhances skin health.
Rose (Rosa spp.) is a thorny shrub with fragrant colorful flowers.
The petals are used in perfumes, teas, and Ayurveda remedies.
Rose helps reduce stress, improves skin health, and soothes digestive problems.
It also has anti-inflammatory, antibacterial, and heart-supporting benefits.
Seethapala (Annona squamosa), also called custard apple, is a small tree with green fruits containing sweet creamy pulp.
The fruit is nutritious and rich in vitamins and minerals.
Medicinally, it improves digestion, boosts immunity, reduces diabetes symptoms, fights anemia, strengthens bones, and has antioxidant effects.
Tecoma (Tecoma stans) is a flowering shrub with bright yellow trumpet-shaped blossoms.
In folk medicine, its leaves and flowers are used to manage diabetes and digestive disorders.
Tecoma reduces inflammation, improves circulation, supports liver health, and strengthens immunity.
Tulsi (Ocimum tenuiflorum), also called Holy Basil, is a sacred plant with aromatic leaves.
It is highly valued in Ayurveda for immunity and respiratory health.
Tulsi treats cough, cold, fever, and stress.
It also purifies blood, controls diabetes, supports heart health, and protects against infections.
Camphor tree (Camphora officinarum) is an evergreen tree with glossy green leaves.
Camphor is extracted from its wood and used in medicine and rituals.
It relieves cough, congestion, and pain.
Camphor also improves circulation, treats skin infections, reduces inflammation, and repels insects.
